noun.description: A way in which a thing is done or happens.
examples: taking notes in an unobtrusive manner

noun.description: A person's outward bearing or way of behaving toward others.

examples: didn't your mother teach you any manners?

phrases: they accuse me of all manner of evil things
As always in such cases, all manner of conspiracy theories immediately sprang up.
A conflict raged at the heart of Europe which posed all manner of seminal questions for the nature of humanity.
The simple answer is to fill in the blanks with all manner of really important things to do.
The door is double-locked, with chains and bolts, because behind it lies all manner of secrets.
origin: Middle English: from Old French maniere, based on Latin manuarius of the hand, from manus hand.
